oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Riders in the Sky Interview - Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of an interview with Riders in the Sky (performance group) conducted by Biff Collie.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Riders in the Sky; Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Fred 'Too Slim' LaBour describes idolizing Roy Rogers as a child and recalls meeting Douglas 'Ranger Doug' Green and Paul 'Woody Paul' Chrisman in Nashville -- (00:56) Green emphasizes LaBour's recollection as correct -- (01:02) Green recalls the amount of time Riders of the Storm have been touring, and Chrisman and LaBour ask Green to continue to keep track of that number -- (01:22) Collie, LaBour and Green discuss how they had originally spent their free time in Nashville -- (02:19) Chrisman discusses his work in auto body and recalls a lie about going to MIT -- (02:58) Collie, LaBour and Chrisman discuss Chrisman's connection to the Grand Ole Opry -- (03:51) LaBour tells of how the Riders in the Sky decided they wanted to play country music -- (04:54) Collie introduces Green's past referring to it as a 'historical sandbox' -- (05:03) Green recalls his upbringing influencing his appreciation for acts like Jimmy Wakely and Eddie Dean -- (05:41) Green and Chrisman introduce Riders in the Sky's sponsor Deadwood Darlene's Prairie Lubricants -- (05:54) Deadwood Darlene's Prairie Lubricants commercial spot performed by Chrisman, LaBour and Green -- (06:42) Collie, Chrisman, Green, and LaBour talk about the blue-collar nature of the Riders in the Sky -- (07:45) Collie and Green discuss the first time Riders in the Sky performed for the Grand Ole Opry and LaBour reveals he has tape of Ernest Tubb introducing the Riders in the Sky as members of the Grand Ole Opry -- (08:55) Chrisman, LaBour and Green discuss the Rider's Radio Theatre -- (09:47) Rider's Radio Theatre's pre-production is reflected on as well as the guests who perform on Rider's Radio Theatre -- (10:20) Green recalls the structure of the performances on Tumbleweed Theatre performed on the Nashville Network -- (10:55) Green, Chrisman and LaBour tell how they created characters and imitate their performing character voices -- (13:08) LaBour recants Chrisman childhood as a country musician and getting a fiddle from Roy Acuff while in school in his 'Side Meat' character voice -- (15:07) Green and Collie discuss Green's upbringing and Green introduces 'Side Meat' to describe Green's past -- (15:41) "Side Meat' recalls how Green grew up at the Great Lakes Navel Station and how Green went to Michigan before moving to Nashville -- (17:09) Collie, Chrisman, and 'Side Meat' discuss the other characters that make appearances and 'Two Jaws' discusses being a dead star -- (19:07) LaBour and character 'Sargent Dudley' discuss Canadian folklore and 'beaver flipping' -- (21:02) LaBour introduces character 'Drywall Paul' and 'Drywall Paul' tries to introduce his own label -- (22:58) 'Drywall Paul,' Collie and the Riders in the Sky talk about how every successful artist wears a hat -- (24:05) Chrisman and Collie joke about construction based songs and LaBour discusses how Riders in the Sky got its name -- (24:47) LaBour tells how the Riders in the Sky's focus is on pushing country music into the future -- (25:25) Collie, Green, Chrisman and LaBour discuss paying homage to Stan Jones and Larry Mammoth while discussing their production team -- (26:46) Collie, Green, Chrisman and LaBour reflect on professionalism in performing -- (27:38) 'The Cowboy Way' is described by LaBour and Green -- (28:23) Green gives thanks to his partners -- (28:47) LaBour describes his role as the head of merchandising and the Riders in the Sky describe how to get merchandise without being at a show -- (30:40) Chrisman's role as the driver and financial expert are discussed -- (30:57) The Riders in the Sky members describe how to listen to Riders Radio Theatre -- (32:21) LaBour says goodbye while Green and LaBour hum in the back ground -- (32:42) Collie and Green discuss the way that Riders in the Sky sign off at the end of a show -- (32:52) So Long Saddle Pals (Riders in the Sky) -- (33:51) Collie and an unknown voice discuss Riders in the Sky doing radio spots -- (34:15) Green, LaBour, and Chrisman radio spot for the Music City Album Review -- (34:27) [Indistinguishable background discussion] -- (34:44) Chrisman demonstrates the radio spot Collie wants to Green and LaBour -- (35:01) Green radio spot for the Riders in the Sky audiobiography -- (35:07) Green radio spot for the Riders in the Sky audiobiography [includes yodel] -- (35:2) 'Side Meat' radio spot for the Riders in the Sky audiobiography -- (35:29) LaBour radio spot for the Riders in the Sky audiobiography -- (35:36) Closing discussion, away from microphone, between Collie, Green, LaBour and Chrisman
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Riders in the Sky; Collie, Biff;
